meanings.definition: To make (someone) a member of the proletariat.
meanings.sent1: The factory owner proletarianised many workers by reducing their wages.
meanings.sent2: The new policies proletarianised the once affluent neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick proletarianised the audience, turning them into ordinary workers.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fury proletarianised the landscape, leaving it barren and desolate.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes vividly proletarianised the canvas, capturing the essence of working-class life.

meanings.definition: To cause (something) to become characteristic of the proletariat.
meanings.sent1: The economic downturn proletarianised the previously luxurious lifestyle.
meanings.sent2: The cultural shift proletarianised the art scene, making it more accessible to all.
meanings.sent3: The chef's unique recipe proletarianised the fine dining experience, making it casual and affordable.
meanings.sent4: The music festival's lineup proletarianised the event, attracting a diverse crowd.
meanings.sent5: The fashion designer's collection boldly proletarianised high fashion, bringing it to the streets.
